resources.string: Analysis of the relationship between UFO sightings and proximity to military installations.
Adjust the radius to see how many UFO sightings occur within a specific distance of military installations.
Analysis of the relationship between UFO sightings and astronomical events.
Analysis of the relationship between UFO sightings and weather conditions.
Analysis of the relationship between UFO sightings and population density.

Research shows a strong relationship between UFO sightings and proximity to military installations, with studies finding that 61% of all UFO sightings occur within 24 miles of a military installation, and 82% within 42 miles.

Many studies indicate that astronomical phenomena are often misidentified as UFOs. Analysis shows strong correlations between meteor shower peaks and \'fireball\' UFO reports, as well as between satellite passes and \'formation\' sightings.

Research has shown correlations between unusual weather conditions (particularly thunderstorms, temperature inversions, and fog) and reported UFO sightings. These conditions can create optical illusions and unusual light refraction.

Studies have found a sub-linear relationship between population density and UFO sightings, indicating that while more people means more potential observers, the relationship is not directly proportional.
Method: Haversine formula used to calculate great-circle distances between sighting coordinates and military base locations.
Method: Date correlation between astronomical event periods and UFO sighting reports.
Method: Spatiotemporal correlation between weather events and UFO sightings within 50km and 24 hours.
Method: Sightings normalized by population density to identify deviations from expected distribution.
Data sources: US Government Military Installation Database, National UFO Reporting Center (NUFORC).
Data sources: International Meteor Organization, NASA/JPL, Space-Track.org, National UFO Reporting Center (NUFORC).
Data sources: National Weather Service, NOAA Storm Events Database, National UFO Reporting Center (NUFORC).
Data sources: US Census Bureau, World Bank population data, National UFO Reporting Center (NUFORC).
